help.comment: We contain the common stuff for contexts (which are containers) and other elements (methods, attributes and so on)

methods.method: There's a wee trick we pull. Comment blocks can have directives that override the stuff we extract during the parse. So, we have a special class method, attr_overridable, that lets code objects list those directives. Wehn a comment is assigned, we then extract out any matching directives and update our object
Update the comment, but don't overwrite a real comment with an empty one
Default callbacks to nothing, but this is overridden for classes and modules
set and cleared by :startdoc: and :enddoc:, this is used to toggle the capturing of documentation
